0.title: After expelling O Panneerselvam, AIADMK sacks his sons & 16 supporters
0.article_body: AIADMK interim chief Edappadi K Palaniswami (EPS) on Thursday expelled O Panneerselvam's sons and 16 other supporters of the ousted leader from the party. This comes days after the AIADMK expelled Panneerselvam. AIADMK on Monday elected Palaniswami as its Interim General Secretary and vested in him full powers to head the organisation.

1.title: Rescue operations almost ended: J&K LG on Amarnath cloudburst
1.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha said the rescue operations after the cloudburst near the Amarnath cave have "almost ended". Every pilgrim is insured with ₹5 lakh and the shrine board has decided to provide additional ₹5 lakh to the families of the deceased, Sinha said. At least 16 people were killed after a cloudburst near Amarnath cave last week.

2.title: Class 12 school student arrested for stabbing classmates in Delhi
2.article_body: A class 12 student was arrested for allegedly stabbing his classmates following a quarrel at a government school in Delhi's Bhati Mines area, police said on Thursday. Mohit (accused) attacked Ankush (victim) with a knife when an argument broke out between the two, DCP (south) Benita Mary Jaiker said. Mohit attacked two other classmates when they intervened, she added.

3.title: Chhattisgarh man kills girlfriend with hammer suspecting infidelity
3.article_body: A 28-year-old man died by suicide after allegedly killing his girlfriend with a hammer and a blade over suspicion of infidelity in Chhattisgarh's Raipur, police said on Wednesday. The accused attacked his girlfriend with a hammer and blade at her rented house, before taking the extreme step, ASP (west) Akash Rao Giripunje said.

4.title: Aamir to appear as special guest on Big B's Kaun Banega Crorepati 14: Reports
4.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan will reportedly be joining Amitabh Bachchan for the first episode of Kaun Banega Crorepati 14. According to reports, the first episode will see a few real-life heroes, from sports stars to army officers and policemen. Reports added that Aamir Khan will also be seen talking about his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' in the episode.

5.title: 90% work of Mopa airport complete, commissioning after Aug 15: Goa CM
5.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said that about 90% work of the Mopa International Airport in the state has been completed. The airport in North Goa district would be commissioned between August 15 and September 1 this year, Sawant said. A skill development centre has started operating at the site where students are being trained for employment, he added.

6.title: Five killed as car rams into a tree in Haryana's Narnaul
6.article_body: Police on Thursday said that five people were killed after the car in which they were travelling rammed into a tree near the Raghunathpura bypass in Haryana's Narnaul. "The car hit a tree along the road," Narnaul city police station SHO Santosh Kumar said. The deceased were in the mid-30 to mid-50 age group, Kumar added.

7.title: Land allotted to build equivalent of IIT in Pak turns into 'bakra mandi'
7.article_body: Dr Umar Saif, ex-Vice-Chancellor of Pakistan's Information Technology University, revealed that the land allotted for the construction of an equivalent of IIT in Pakistan has turned into a 'bakra mandi'. He tweeted that the land was kept aside for the construction of the institute in 2013. He shared pictures from the site, showing how the area has turned into marketplace.

8.title: Sri Lanka President allowed entry on private visit, hasn't been granted asylum: Singapore
8.article_body: Singapore government has confirmed that Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has been allowed entry on a "private visit". "He has not asked for asylum and neither has he been granted any asylum. Singapore generally does not grant requests for asylum," said Singapore government. Sri Lanka Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe was named acting President after Rajapaksa fled Sri Lanka.

9.title: MCD issues notices to 40,000 Delhi residents over property tax
9.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi has issued notices to around 40,000 residents whose property tax records of any financial year or payment receipts are not available with the MCD, officials said on Wednesday. Notably, some of the residents have been asked to furnish tax receipts dating as far back as 2004. AAP has called for the notices to be withdrawn.

10.title: Drug peddler arrested with marijuana worth ₹4.7 lakh in Pune
10.article_body: Pune Police on Wednesday arrested a drug peddler who was caught with 23.6 kg of marijuana worth ₹4.7 lakh. The accused, identified as Suraj Kantilal Bora, was nabbed at Lonikand after the anti-narcotics cell of the Pune Police received a tip-off on his whereabouts. Bora has been booked under sections of the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

11.title: Rupee drops 9 paise to close at all-time low of 79.90 against US dollar
11.article_body: The rupee declined by 9 paise to close at a new record low of 79.90 against the US dollar on Thursday. At the interbank foreign exchange market, the local currency opened at 79.72 and witnessed intra-day high of 79.71 and a low of 79.92 against the US dollar. Meanwhile, brent crude futures, the global oil benchmark, dropped 2.20% to $97.38/barrel.

12.title: Ruraltech startup FAARMS raises $10 mn in a funding round
12.article_body: Ruraltech startup FAARMS has raised $10 million in a recent funding round. The round was led by Dr Cornelius Boersch, Founder of Conny & Co., Singaporean angel investor Koh Boon Hwee, and saw participation from Apoorva Ranjan Sharma, Co-founder of Venture Catalysts and 9 Unicorns, among others. The Bengaluru-based startup was founded by Taranbir Singh and Alok Duggal in 2020.

13.title: Edtech unicorn upGrad acquires recruitment company WOLVES
13.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad's subsidiary, upGrad Rekrut, has acquired Bengaluru-based recruitment and staffing firm WOLVES, for an undisclosed amount. Founded in 2014, WOLVES India places tech talent across startups, along with mid-size and large organisations and has closed over 5,000 placements till date. WOLVES India will operate independently as a subsidiary of upGrad Rekrut, as per a statement.

14.title: Twitter down for thousands of users across the globe
14.article_body: Twitter is down for thousands of users across the globe, according to outage tracking website Downdetector. The issues started with the service at around 5:40 pm IST, with a lot of users reporting 'over capacity' error messages. It is the first major Twitter outage since February, as per The Verge.

15.title: Will is apologetic: Kevin on Will Smith-Chris Rock slap controversy at Oscars
15.article_body: Actor Will Smith's friend Kevin Hart opened up about how Will is doing after the slap controversy. He said that Will is "apologetic and he's in a "better space". "I can...hope that the two of them find a way to find some solace in that and move past it," he added. "Ultimately, life goes on and people grow," Kevin said.

16.title: Centre upgrades security of Kumar Vishwas to Y+ category
16.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs has upgraded the security of former Aam Aadmi Party leader Kumar Vishwas from Y to Y+ category, ANI reported. The decision is based on a threat assessment report by Intelligence Bureau. In February, the Centre had granted Y security cover to Vishwas after he accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of having links with separatist outfits.

17.title: ₹229 crore allotted to restore 26 lakes in Bengaluru
17.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike will spend ₹229 crore to restore 26 lakes in Bengaluru, as concretisation threatens its water resources. While the detailed project reports (DPRs) for 10 lakes have been prepared, the civic body is calling for public suggestions to complete the remaining DPRs. Citizens have demanded the DPRs be prepared online to maintain transparency.

18.title: Bhutan to reopen for foreign tourists from Sept, will triple entry fees
18.article_body: Bhutan will reopen its borders to foreign tourists for first time since pandemic broke out in 2020 from September 23 onwards. Bhutan will hike its sustainable development fees, which is mandatory to enter country, from $65 (over ₹5,000) per night, per person to $200 (over ₹15,000). "COVID-19 has allowed us to...rethink how [tourism] sector can be best...operated," Foreign Minister said.

19.title: Removing gangster culture, curbing drug menace priority: Punjab DGP
19.article_body: Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav on Thursday said eliminating gangster culture and controlling the drug menace are the top priorities of the state police. The state police is committed to maintaining law and order, he said, asserting that the Punjab Police is one of the best police forces in the world. We will ensure people-friendly police, he added.

20.title: Don't want to be on another platform: Ranbir on staying away from social media
20.article_body: When asked why he is not there on social media, actor Ranbir Kapoor said, "I don’t want to be on another platform and put in hard work and show my personality there." "I am a film actor and would love to remain so," he added. On the professional front, Ranbir will be next seen in the film 'Shamshera'.

21.title: No word has been banned, clarifies Lok Sabha Speaker on 'unparliamentary' words
21.article_body: Amid criticism over a list of words deemed unfit for Parliament that included terms like 'corrupt' and 'incompetent', Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said no word had been "banned". "We've issued a compilation of...words that have been expunged," Birla added. "Earlier a book of...unparliamentary words used to be released...To avoid wastage of papers, we've put it on internet," he stated.

22.title: CAQM frames new policy to fight air pollution in Delhi-NCR
22.article_body: The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) on Wednesday unveiled a new policy to curb air pollution in Delhi and National Capital Region (NCR). The policy lists sector-wise action plans to reduce air pollution in the next five years. One of the measures the policy suggests is the phasing out of diesel-run auto-rickshaws in NCR by December 31, 2026.

23.title: SIT gets 4 more days to interrogate 4 Moosewala killing suspects
23.article_body: Punjab Police's Special Investigation Team (SIT) has received four more days to interrogate four suspects, including two shooters, over the murder of Sidhu Moosewala. This comes as a Mansa court on Wednesday extended the police remand for these suspects till Sunday. The SIT had said that their further custodial interrogation is required to recover the weapons used in the crime.

24.title: Did films where my heart wasn't there, won't do them again: Rajkummar
24.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao said he did one or two films, where his heart wasn't there and he'll not be doing that anymore. "I want to go back home after a day's work and think 'you know, I did something good today'," he added. "I want to feel content doing that job. So I'm gonna...be in that process forever," he said.

25.title: IRCTC offers 6-day tour package to Nepal from Aug 8, starting at ₹38,400
25.article_body: The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) has announced a six-day and five-night air package for Nepal, starting at ₹38,400 per person. The tourists will get to cover Pashupatinath Temple, Patan and Durbar Square, among other locations, during the journey, which will commence on August 8. The flight will depart at 7:45 am from Madhya Pradesh’s Bhopal airport.

26.title: Daler Mehndi arrested after court upholds 2-year sentence in human trafficking case
26.article_body: Singer Daler Mehndi has been arrested and sent to jail after a Patiala court on Thursday dismissed the appeal filed by him against his two-year jail sentence in a human trafficking case registered against him in 2003. Daler and his brother were sentenced to two years in jail in 2018, following which they were granted bail.

27.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd ODI against England, Virat Kohli returns
27.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against England in the second ODI at Lord's. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Virat Kohli replacing Shreyas Iyer. Kohli had missed the first ODI due to a groin strain. England are fielding an unchanged playing XI.

28.title: Pakistan will be more challenging than Australia: SL captain Karunaratne
28.article_body: Sri Lanka's Test captain Dimuth Karunaratne said it will be "more challenging" for his team to face Pakistan in their upcoming two-match Test series, in comparison to the recently concluded Test series against Australia which ended 1-1. "Pakistan's...a brilliant team...They play spin well," added Karunaratne. "Playing at the same venue three times is a big advantage for us," he stated.

29.title: Over 5 crore pilgrims expected in U'khand during Kanwar Yatra: CM Dhami
29.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami on Thursday said that the state is expecting a footfall of more than five crore pilgrims during the Kanwar Yatra this year. "We have made all the arrangements regarding the smooth conduct and safety during the Kanwar Yatra," he said. "We appeal to them to follow the rules made by the administration," Dhami added.

30.title: Wall collapses on labourers amid heavy rains in Gujarat, 3 killed
30.article_body: Two women labourers and a 16-year-old girl were killed after a boundary wall near an under-construction site collapsed on them amid heavy rainfall in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Thursday. A total of five workers were injured in the incident. Ahmedabad recorded an average rainfall of 27 mm in the morning hours.

31.title: Not Chinese people, some Chinese hardliners consider me separatist: Dalai Lama
31.article_body: The Dalai Lama on Thursday said not Chinese people but some Chinese "hardliners" consider him a separatist. "Now, more and more Chinese are realising that Dalai Lama is not seeking independence but within China meaningful autonomy and to preserve Tibetan Buddhist culture," he said in Jammu. He will make his first trip to Leh in about four years on Friday.

32.title: All clearances given for Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train: Maha Dy CM Fadnavis
32.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has given all clearances for expediting the Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project, said state Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis. The pending approvals were related to issues like forest clearances and land acquisition among others, he added. The total estimated cost of the bullet train project is ₹1,10,000 crore.

33.title: Delhi court asks for CCTV footage after Sharjeel Imam claims assault in jail
33.article_body: A Delhi court on Thursday asked for CCTV footage of a Tihar Jail cell after activist Sharjeel Imam claimed that he was assaulted inside his cell. Imam, who is in judicial custody in connection with the 2020 Northeast Delhi riots case, had alleged that he was called "terrorist" and "anti-national" by the assistant superintendent of Tihar Jail and eight-nine convicts.

34.title: 9 bikes charred after fire breaks out in Pune residential building
34.article_body: As many as nine motorcycles were charred after a fire broke out in a residential building in Pune's Chandan Nagar on Thursday. The fire, which broke out in the building's parking lot, was controlled before it could spread to the houses, police said, adding that no one was injured. The fire was caused by a short circuit, preliminary probe found.

35.title: Over 52,000 Kashmiris dependent on drugs, of them 95% use heroin: Survey
35.article_body: At least 2.8% of Kashmir's total population has been substance users, with 52,404 dependent on drugs currently, according to a latest survey conducted by the Jammu and Kashmir government. As per the report, out of the total drug dependents, approximately 95% are heroin users. The average age of initiation of heroin in Kashmiris is 22, the survey found.

36.title: 1 dead, over 80 injured amid ongoing anti-govt protests in Colombo
36.article_body: At least one person has died and over 80 others were left injured on Wednesday amid ongoing anti-government protests in Sri Lanka's Colombo, reports stated. The deceased, a 26-year-old man, reportedly died after developing breathing difficulties when forces opened tear gas to quell protesters. A curfew has been imposed in Colombo till 5 am on July 15 to prevent unrest.

37.title: Shah Jahan didn't invite quotations for Taj: Goa Minister on not floating tender for work
37.article_body: Goa Minister for Art and Culture Govind Gaude cited the example of Taj Mahal to defend the government's decision to not seek tenders for the renovation work of Kala Academy. He said, "How is Taj Mahal beautiful and everlasting even today? Because Shah Jahan never invited any quotations. Now it's almost 390 years and Taj Mahal stands as it is."

38.title: No contempt proceedings against ex-HC judge, others for criticising SC's remarks on Nupur
38.article_body: Attorney General KK Venugopal has said there can be no contempt-of-court proceedings against a former Delhi HC judge and two lawyers who had criticised Supreme Court's observations on Nupur Sharma for her remark against Prophet Muhammad. "Fair and reasonable criticism of judicial proceedings would not constitute contempt of court," he said. The comments by them were not abusive, Venugopal stated.

39.title: 5 arrested for helping Moosewala killing suspect get fake passport
39.article_body: Police have said that a Delhi-based gang helped Sachin Thapan Bishnoi in procuring a forged passport. Sachin, nephew of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, is allegedly one of the key conspirators in the Sidhu Moosewala murder case. Five people, including a 27-year-old woman, have been arrested for helping Sachin procure the passport. Police suspect they also helped Anmol Bishnoi get a passport.

40.title: New dictionary for new India: Rahul on 'unparliamentary' words list
40.article_body: Congress’ Rahul Gandhi reacted to list of words that are banned in Parliament. "New dictionary for new India," Rahul tweeted. "Unparliamentary: Words used in discussions and debates which correctly describe PM’s handling of government, now banned from being spoken," the image Gandhi tweeted, read. "Example...'Jumlajeevi tanashah shed crocodile tears when his lies...were exposed'," he added.

41.title: MCD launches QR code-based plastic waste collection service in Karol Bagh
41.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) Karol Bagh zone, in collaboration with an NGO, has launched a QR code-based initiative for the collection of plastic waste. The civic body will try to implement this facility in other zones under the corporation, an official said. Through this initiative, plastic will be prevented from reaching landfill sites, the official added.

42.title: 2 killed after Greek firefighting helicopter crashes into sea
42.article_body: Two people were killed after a helicopter fighting a forest fire on the Greek island of Samos crashed into the sea on Wednesday, the Greek coast guard said. Two others on board the helicopter have been rescued, it added. The accident reportedly occurred when the helicopter was resupplying sea water to fight a fire that broke out near Paleochori village.

43.title: How can 15 students decide?: Delhi HC junks plea to postpone NEET-UG
43.article_body: Delhi High Court on Thursday dismissed a plea seeking postponement of the NEET-UG exam scheduled for July 17, saying there is no merit in the petition. "How can 15 students decide whether the exam should be postponed or not? You were aware of these things in April," the court said. It added that these types of petitions should be discouraged.

44.title: Noida Police arrests 14 Chinese nationals for illegally staying in India
44.article_body: As many as 14 Chinese nationals were detained from Noida's Sector 49 Police Station limits for allegedly staying in India illegally since 2020. They all worked for a private company in Noida and possessed valid passports but their business visas had expired, police said. Last month, a Chinese national was arrested for not having a valid passport or visa.

45.title: Harbhajan said play smartly, got out himself: Kaif on 2002 NatWest final
45.article_body: Discussing the 2002 NatWest Final between India and England where he scored an unbeaten 87, ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said Harbhajan Singh asked him to play smartly but got bowled himself. India chased down a target of 326 following a partnership of 120 runs between Yuvraj Singh and Kaif. Harbhajan stated that the win changed the face of Indian cricket.

46.title: Ola Electric invests $100 mn in battery cell research: Report
46.article_body: Ola Electric, the electric vehicle arm of Ola, has invested $100 million in lithium-ion battery cell research and development, according to reports from brokerages ICICI Securities and Edelweiss. CEO Bhavish Aggarwal unveiled the first indigenously developed lithium-ion battery cell. Ola will begin the mass production of the cell by 2023 and aims to develop the in-house capability by 2026.

47.title: BMC collects ₹2.85 lakh fine from plastic ban violators in 2 weeks
47.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has seized 225 kg of plastic and collected a fine of ₹2.85 lakh under a drive that began on July 1. "A ward-wise team of officials has inspected 6,600 places and taken action against 55 violators using banned plastic," an official said. The state legislature passed a law prohibiting the use of plastic in 2018.

48.title: Mumbai man held for trying to extort ₹25,000 per month from spa manager
48.article_body: A 35-year-old man, Sudai Yadav alias Sudhir Master, was arrested for allegedly trying to extort ₹25,000 per month from the manager of a spa in south Mumbai for allowing the establishment to operate, police said. The accused has five offences, including rape and extortion, registered against him, an official said. A complaint has been lodged under IPC section 384 (extortion).

49.title: H'yana vigilance dept nabbed 91 officials in last 6 months for taking bribe
49.article_body: The Haryana State Vigilance Bureau has arrested 91 government officials from January to June 30 this year for accepting bribes. The officers were arrested for taking bribes ranging from ₹5,000 to ₹5 lakh in separate cases. "On average, 15 public servants were arrested on corruption charges every month," a spokesperson of the State Vigilance Bureau said on Thursday.

50.title: IMF reaches staff-level deal with Pak to disburse $1.17 bn in funds
50.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Thursday announced it had reached a staff-level agreement with Pakistan that would pave the way for disbursement of $1.17 billion. The latest tranche is part of a $6-billion loan programme of the IMF. "The Agreement with the Fund has set the stage to bring country out of economic difficulties," PM Shehbaz Sharif said.

51.title: CSK's Robin Uthappa blessed with a baby girl, shares family pic
51.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) batter Robin Uthappa and his wife Shheethal have been blessed with their second child, a baby girl. Sharing a family picture on Instagram, Uthappa wrote, "With hearts that are full we'd love to introduce our newest angel in our lives. Introducing Trinity Thea Uthappa." Robin and Shheethal got married in 2016.

52.title: GHMC along with Hyderabad Police bust synthetic fingerprint scam
52.article_body: The GHMC Enforcement Vigilance and Disaster Management wing along with Hyderabad Police busted a synthetic fingerprint scam. A probe was initiated after reports stated that some supervisors in sanitation division used fake fingerprints to indicate biometric attendance. "Several personnel were not physically present...but their attendance was being recorded on a regular basis," an official said.

53.title: Woman forced to drink acid for giving birth to girl child in Assam; dead
53.article_body: A woman in Assam's Karimganj died after her husband and in-laws allegedly forced her to consume acid for giving birth to a girl child. According to police, family members of the deceased have alleged that she was being tortured physically and mentally by her husband and in-laws for the last few days. Police have arrested her husband.

54.title: My govt committed to all-round development of Maha: CM Shinde
54.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said he was a "sevak" and his government was committed to the all-round development of the state and the welfare of its citizens. Shinde said that the decisions for the people should have been taken two and a half years back, but since that did not happen, 50 MLAs had to take a stand.

55.title: Two-wheeler offender apprehended in Hyderabad, 22 bikes seized
55.article_body: Hyderabad's Uppal Police apprehended a two-wheeler offender and recovered 22 bikes worth ₹13.5 lakh from him, Rachakonda Police tweeted. The accused has been identified as 19-year-old Raju, who used to work in Hyderabad's LB Nagar. The accused was stopped during a vehicle check and when questioned, he confessed to have committed 22 two-wheeler thefts, police said.

56.title: I wish I had done Allu Arjun's role in 'Pushpa': Ranbir Kapoor
56.article_body: In an interview, Ranbir Kapoor said he wishes he'd done Allu Arjun's role in 'Pushpa: The Rise', adding that Ramayana is one of his all-time favourite books. Arjun had earlier shared that it felt like he'd done four films together after working in 'Pushpa: The Rise'. Arjun has previously drawn praise from Shah Rukh Khan, having been termed "too wonderful".

57.title: I've lot more tolerance for bullshit now, I've calmed down a lot: Taapsee
57.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said that she's a very different person from what she was in the beginning. "I've a lot more tolerance for bullshit now, to begin with. I've kind of like calmed down a lot from what I was before," she added. "I was way too over-impulsive [before]...Not my monkey, not my business. I've learned that attitude...little," Taapsee said.

58.title: Remains of 8,000 Nazi war victims found in mass grave in Poland
58.article_body: A mass grave containing 17.5 tonnes of human ashes, equivalent to at least 8,000 people, was unearthed near a former Nazi concentration camp in Poland, the country's national remembrance institute said. The bodies are thought to have been burned in a Nazi operation to hide evidence of their murders. The victims "were probably assassinated around 1939", investigator Tomasz Jankowski said.

59.title: US Judge rejects Amber Heard's request for new trial with Johnny Depp
59.article_body: Judge Penney Azcarate, the Virginia judge who oversaw Johnny Depp's defamation case against actress Amber Heard, has rejected actress Heard's request for a new trial. This comes after Heard's lawyers had alleged that the wrong juror sat during the trial. "Defendant does not allege Juror Fifteen's inclusion on the jury prejudiced her in any way," Azcarate wrote.

60.title: Ignoring Samson for Shreyas beyond cricketing rationale: Ex-cricketer Ganesh
60.article_body: Reacting to India's squad for West Indies T20Is, ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh said the omission of Sanju Samson is "beyond rationale". He tweeted, "Ideally, you'd want players like Sanju Samson in the T20Is. Ignoring him for Shreyas Iyer is beyond cricketing rationale." Samson was part of India's squad for the first England T20I but wasn't included in playing XI.

61.title: Trader uses ₹36 cr fake invoices, evades ₹13 cr GST in Pune; held
61.article_body: Officials of the Maharashtra GST department have arrested a 26-year-old Pune-based trader for allegedly using fake invoices worth ₹36.34 crore and evading GST of ₹13.08 crore. Doulat Shivlal Choudhary will remain in judicial custody till July 27, 2022. The arrest was made after the GST department noticed suspicious business activity by Choudhary's Shiv Steel Traders amounting to over ₹72.68 crore.

62.title: Alt News Co-founder Zubair moves SC to quash 6 FIRs against him in UP
62.article_body: Alt News Co-founder and fact-checker Mohammed Zubair on Thursday approached the Supreme Court seeking to quash all six FIRs registered against him in Uttar Pradesh. Meanwhile, a court in UP's Hathras on Thursday sent him to 14-day judicial custody. The UP government has formed a two-member Special Investigation Team to probe the six cases lodged against Zubair.

63.title: ED arrests former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, gets 4-day remand in money laundering case
63.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) arrested former CEO and MD of National Stock Exchange (NSE) Chitra Ramkrishna in a money laundering case. The ED filed the case in connection with the illegal phone tapping case and the snooping case of employees of the stock exchange. In March, Chitra was arrested by CBI in connection with the NSE co-location case in Delhi.

64.title: You can't say it's Hooda vs Kohli, Hooda has played 3-4 matches: Piyush Chawla
64.article_body: Amid Virat Kohli's criticism over his recent form, former India spinner Piyush Chawla has said the former India captain is someone who walks into Team India's playing XI "straightaway". Chawla added, "Deepak Hooda has just played three-four games at the international level...you can't say it's Kohli vs Hooda." Kohli has been rested for the white-ball tour of West Indies.

65.title: Context is important in what you speak in Parliament: Owaisi on list of words banned
65.article_body: Reacting to a list of words that are now banned in the Parliament, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said context is important in what you speak in the Parliament. "You cannot just term words unparliamentary," he added. Lok Sabha Secretariat has released a list of words that will be considered unparliamentary which includes 'corrupt', 'jumlajeevi' and 'lie' among other words.

66.title: Arms including AK-47, cane bombs recovered from Maoist hideouts in Bihar
66.article_body: A huge cache of arms, including an AK-47 rifle, suspected to be hidden by Maoists was recovered from forest areas in Bihar's Gaya and Aurangabad districts on Wednesday. "It is suspected that [the] Maoist group...escaped before the troops reached the spot," said Gaya SSP Harpreet Kaur. Police also recovered 372 cane bombs and 394 live cartridges among other items.

67.title: Terror module busted in Bihar; 3 including retired J'khand police officer held
67.article_body: As many as three people, including a retired police officer of Jharkhand, were arrested in a suspected terror module, officials said on Thursday. "Because PM Narendra Modi was coming, we were alert...we came to know about these people's office and we started investigating it closely," police said. Notably, PM Modi visited Jharkhand's Deoghar and Bihar's Patna on July 12.

68.title: Several areas in Bengaluru to face power cuts on July 14-15
68.article_body: Several areas in Bengaluru will face power outages on July 14 and 15 to carry out repair and maintenance works in the city, as per Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited's (BESCOM) website. Most of these works will be carried out between 10 am and 6 pm. PB Road and KTJ Nagar are a few areas to face power cuts today.

69.title: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' return postponed to September: Report
69.article_body: 'The Kapil Sharma Show', which was set to return on-air in August, will reportedly now return in September. "Kapil has...shows till the end of July in the USA...will also perform in Australia on the first weekend of September," a source stated. The source added the channel decided to push the show to September as 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14' will begin.

70.title: Shinde's illegal govt doing no work for floods in Maha: Sanjay Raut
70.article_body: Calling Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's government illegal, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said they are not doing anything for the flood-like situation in the state. "Twelve days have passed and the Maharashtra government is not doing any work...Where is the Governor of Maharashtra for 12 days when the state is suffering from flood-like situations?" Raut said.

71.title: IAF officer stuck with family & dog in SUV amid Pune floods, rescued
71.article_body: An Indian Air Force officer and his family, stuck inside their SUV, which was sinking due to flooding near Pune's Harris Bridge, were rescued along with their pet dog by the fire brigade on Wednesday. The IAF officer's children reportedly climbed atop the vehicle as water levels rose. Fire brigade officials used safety ropes to rescue the family.

72.title: Kevin Spacey pleads not guilty to sex offence charges in UK, to go on trial next year
72.article_body: Actor Kevin Spacey has pleaded not guilty to four charges of sexually assaulting three men and a fifth charge of causing a person to engage in penetrative sexual activity without consent at London's Old Bailey. Police said the alleged assaults occurred between 2005 and 2013. Spacey will now go on trial in London, beginning on June 6 next year.

73.title: Pictures of Deepika Padukone's lookalike Rijuta Ghosh Deb go viral
73.article_body: Pictures of Rijuta Ghosh Deb have gone viral, with several social media users calling her Deepika Padukone's lookalike. Rijuta describes herself as a digital creator on her Instagram bio. "At first I thought she's Deepika Padukone," a comment on one of her posts read. "Deepika Padukone's doppelganger," an Instagram user wrote while another comment read, "You look like Deepika Padukone."

74.title: 23-yr-old kickboxer Nikhil dies after getting punched during championship in Bengaluru
74.article_body: A 23-year-old kickboxer named Nikhil passed away at a hospital after getting punched during a state-level K1 kickboxing championship in Bengaluru. The Bengaluru police have registered a case of negligence against the organisers of the competition. A video from the event shows Nikhil collapsing in the ring after getting punched in the face by his opponent.

75.title: I switch off the TV after a point: Ravichandran Ashwin on ODI cricket
75.article_body: Talking about the state of ODI cricket, Ravichandran Ashwin said, "Greatest beauty of one-day cricket is...sorry...was...ebbs and flows of the game." He added, "People used to bide their time and take the game deep." Ashwin stated, "Even me...as a cricket badger and a cricket nut...I switch off the TV after a point and that's frankly very scary for the format."

76.title: Thane's Ulhas river water level comes down from danger level
76.article_body: The water level of Ulhas river, which reached 17.70 metres on Wednesday crossing the danger level, came down to 14.90 metres on Thursday morning. The rural areas of Badlapur and Kalyan talukas were alerted after the water level increased. Around 300 riverside residents were shifted to safer places and those having riverside houses were instructed to move to upper floors.

77.title: England gift jersey to 6-yr-old girl who was hit by Rohit's six, pic goes viral
77.article_body: England gifted their jersey to the six-year-old girl who was hit by Rohit Sharma's 79-metre six during the first ODI at The Oval in London. A picture of the girl holding a brand new England jersey has gone viral on social media. "Laudable gesture," a fan commented on the viral picture.

78.title: Trump called witness who is yet to appear before committee investigating Jan 6 riots
78.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump called a witness who is yet to appear before a congressional committee investigating the January 6 US Capitol attack. The witness did not pick up Trump's call but did tell their lawyer. "We will take any effort to influence witness testimony very seriously," the committee said.

79.title: Plants bud in newly asphalted road in B'luru; BBMP faces criticism
79.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is facing criticism from the residents after plants sprouted from a newly asphalted road in Varthur. The civic body had spent ₹24 crores on the road, which was laid just 10 days ago. The residents alleged that the soil under it wasn't cleared before asphalting, hence the seeds germinated with plants sprouting from it.

80.title: Priest begins protest outside Hong Kong jail for release of activists
80.article_body: A Catholic priest launched a three-day protest outside a maximum security prison in Hong Kong on Thursday. Franco Mella, a longtime rights activist in the Chinese-ruled city, is demanding the release of activists and democratic politicians held under a national security law. The 74-year-old has pledged not to eat for the entire duration of his protest.

81.title: Water storage in Pune dams rises as rains continue to lash city
81.article_body: The water storage in all four dams upstream of the Mutha river in Pune has increased to 14.11 TMC as heavy rains continue to lash the city. The Panshet area witnessed 128 mm rainfall and Khadakwasla 54 mm rainfall in the last 24 hours. The Khadakwasla dam is filled to capacity and water is being released to Mutha river.

82.title: Russia's economic shock to blame for Sri Lanka crisis: Zelenskyy
82.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has blamed Russia for creating an "economic shock" by blocking food exports amid the Ukraine war, which he said led to crisis in Sri Lanka. "Shocking food and fuel price hikes led to...social explosion [in Sri Lanka]," he added. Zelenskyy also said that disruption in the global supply chain of these products has benefited Russia's agenda.

83.title: #Bazball: Jimmy Neesham reacts to his 91-run knock in county match
83.article_body: Reacting to a video of his shots from his 91-run innings for Northamptonshire, New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham tweeted, "#Bazball". The term 'Bazball' is being used for England's aggressive approach in Test cricket. Neesham slammed 11 fours and two sixes in his 91-run innings off 101 balls in a recent county match.

84.title: Father, 2 friends get 20-yr jail for gang-rape of minor daughter in Mumbai
84.article_body: A father and his two friends have been convicted to 20 years in jail for gang-rape of his 16-year-old daughter in Mumbai over a period of two months in 2018. The father was earlier in jail in an attempt to murder case. The victim claimed her father had begun sexually assaulting her a few days after his return from jail.

85.title: Bomb squad deployed as suspicious cylinder found in J&K's Akhnoor
85.article_body: A suspicious cylinder was found in the Akhnoor sector of Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday, the local police said. Bomb squad and police have been deployed at the spot. More details are awaited. This comes after police and security forces defused a gas cylinder fitted with five-kg firecrackers in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Tuesday.

86.title: 3 people injured in leopard attack in Rajasthan's Jaipur
86.article_body: Three villagers were injured after a leopard attacked them in Rajasthan's Jaipur on Thursday. According to police, the leopard had entered the village at around 2:30 am. It later entered a building of the Apex University following which it was tranquillised by a forest department team, police added. One of the victims suffered serious injuries, said SHO Dilip Singh.

87.title: SRK not factor behind quitting 'Dunki', he's too much of a gentleman: DOP
87.article_body: Amit Roy, who recently quit as the Director of Photography of 'Dunki', has said that the film's lead actor Shah Rukh Khan was not the factor behind quitting the film. "It was a thing between a director and DOP. SRK is anyway too gentlemanly to get into that relationship," he added. The film is directed by Rajkumar Hirani.

88.title: Trained extensively for Bihari dialect: Janhvi on her role in Good Luck Jerry
88.article_body: Speaking about her role in 'Good Luck Jerry', actress Janhvi Kapoor said she trained extensively for 'Bihari' accent. "I trained extensively for the Bihari dialect. I was made to do an exercise wherein [my coach] would make me say Bihari abuses as a part of the training," she added. "The whole process was...lot of fun eventually," Janhvi said.

89.title: England shouldn't think of scoring 350 right from start: RP Singh
89.article_body: Ahead of the second ODI between England and India, ex-cricketer RP Singh has said England shouldn't think of scoring 350 right from the start and need to "change their template a bit". He added, "[England] will have to assess the conditions first and then adjust." India dismissed England for 110 runs and won the first ODI by 10 wickets.

90.title: Won't support any law that mandates 2 children: Owaisi
90.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that he will not support any law that mandates two children only policy as it would not benefit the country. "We should not repeat the mistakes of China...India's total fertility rate is declining, by 2030 it will stabilise," he added. Earlier, he criticised UP CM Yogi Adityanath over his "population imbalance" remark.

91.title: 4 hospitals ordered to shut permanently after 16-yr-old was forced to sell her eggs in TN
91.article_body: Four hospitals in Tamil Nadu were ordered to shut permanently by the state health department for their alleged involvement in sale of egg cells of a 16-year-old. The girl was forced by her mother to sell her egg cells eight times. "Aadhaar card was forged to show the minor...as...adult. A fictitious husband's consent was obtained," the state Health Minister said.

92.title: Depends on book in Parliament that decides on words being unparliamentary: Kharge
92.article_body: Reacting to a list of words that are now banned in Parliament, Congress’ Mallikarjun Kharge said it depends on book in the Parliament that decides on words being unparliamentary. "We'll use those words that he (PM Modi) had used in his parliamentary career, we'll tell him what words he used in debates. He himself used these words," Kharge added.

93.title: Patralekhaa putting sindoor on me on our wedding was impulsive: Rajkummar
93.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao, opening up about his wife Patralekhaa putting sindoor on him on their wedding day, has said that none of them had planned it. "We both are equal and that's how it should be. So, yeah, it was very impulsive...I am glad it happened and I am hoping that somewhere it [struck] people's hearts," he further added.

94.title: India announce their squad for T20I series against West Indies, Kohli not included
94.article_body: India have announced their squad for the T20I series against West Indies. Virat Kohli and Jasprit Bumrah have not been included in the squad, while KL Rahul and Kuldeep Yadav have been included subject to fitness. The squad also includes Ravichandran Ashwin, Ravi Bishnoi, Harshal Patel, Arshdeep Singh and Avesh Khan.

95.title: Man kidnaps & rapes 13-year-old girl in Gurugram; booked
95.article_body: Police have booked a man for allegedly raping a 13-year-old girl in Gurugram. The accused, who lives in the same neighbourhood, had allegedly been raping her for two months. "She said that he had threatened to kill her family if she revealed it to anyone," her father claimed. He also alleged that the accused had kidnapped her on July 8.

96.title: I sprained my neck a week before the shoot: Dhanush on 'The Gray Man'
96.article_body: Dhanush, who will next be seen in 'The Gray Man', revealed he sprained his neck a week before filming began. "I...was like 'What am I going to do?' The physio had..a week's time to get me ready to match Ana De Armas' speed," he stated. "Somehow, they found a way to make me fit for the stunt sequence," he added.

97.title: India will struggle if they look at Hardik as their 5th bowler: Nehra
97.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said Team India will struggle if they are considering all-rounder Hardik Pandya as their fifth bowler in ODIs. "He can only be your sixth bowler," added Nehra. "Hardik [won't go]...to...West Indies for [the] ODIs which is good," he stated. Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar had earlier said he's worried about the all-rounder bowling 10 overs in ODIs.

98.title: Hyd police arrests 1 person for procuring fake educational certificates
98.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Wednesday said that it has arrested one person for procuring fake educational certificates. Police also seized fake marksheets and certificate of Himalayan University from the accused. According to police, the accused works at an IT company in Hyderabad. He did not complete his graduation and had thus obtained the fake certificates by paying ₹75,000, police added.

99.title: FM has called planets to rescue the economy: P Chidambaram
99.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram said, "We're not surprised that Finance Minister tweeted pictures of Jupiter, Pluto and Uranus on the day when inflation printed at 7.01% and unemployment printed at 7.8%," he tweeted. "To begin with, she should appoint new CEA: Chief Economic Astrologer," he added. "The FM has called the planets to...rescue of the economy," he further added.

100.title: Ever tried putting lion on leash, it breaks: Cong's Manish Tewari
100.article_body: Congress leader Manish Tewari on Wednesday tweeted, "Ever tried putting a lion on a leash? Only one thing happens, the leash breaks." Earlier, Tewari refused to sign a letter by the Opposition against the Agnipath scheme. Tewari, who was one of the Opposition MPs to meet Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, didn't sign letter that sought withdrawal or scrutiny of scheme.

101.title: You cannot drop Virat Kohli straightaway: Ashish Nehra
101.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's current form, ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said, "You cannot just drop him straightaway because of his lack of runs." Nehra stated, "He has scored ample runs in international cricket and has done so much for the country." Nehra further stated, "Yes...he hasn’t been consistent and he himself would be knowing...he hasn’t performed up to his calibre."

102.title: Biggest Supermoon of 2022 lights up night skies around the world, pics surface
102.article_body: The biggest Supermoon of 2022 lit up night skies around the world, with the Moon being closest to the Earth at a distance of 3,57,264 km. The July 13 full Moon is also called the Buck Moon because the antlers of bucks or male deer normally grow around this time, as per The Old Farmer's Almanac.

103.title: Next we'll be asked to wear saffron dress: Adhir on 'unparliamentary' words list
103.article_body: Reacting to the new list of unparliamentary words released by Lok Sabha Secretariat, Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said that Centre is making a "second republic" by bringing such rules. "At present, they (Centre) are saying that certain words can't be used inside Parliament, tomorrow they'll ask to enter premises in a saffron dress," the Congress leader said.

104.title: Petrol price cut by ₹5 per litre, diesel price by ₹3 per litre in Maharashtra
104.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Thursday announced that the price of petrol and diesel in the state will be reduced by ₹5 per litre and ₹3 per litre respectively. This comes days after the Chief Minister said that his government will cut VAT on fuel to provide relief to the people of Maharashtra.

105.title: Curfew imposed in Colombo till Friday morning to prevent further unrest
105.article_body: Sri Lanka's acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe has imposed a curfew in Colombo from 12 pm on July 14 to 5 am on July 15 in a bid to prevent further unrest. Wickremesinghe was appointed as acting President after Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country with his wife amid mass protests over the economic crisis. Protesters are also demanding Wickremesinghe's resignation.

106.title: Big-screen offerings remain my main focus: Ranveer on his OTT debut
106.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who recently made his OTT debut with 'Ranveer vs Wild', has said that he is most comfortable playing characters in theatres. "The big-screen offerings remain my main focus," he stated. Ranveer added, "That said, I'm grateful that the OTT platform has offered me the opportunity to endear myself and entertain the audience."

107.title: 10-yr-old rape victim went to neighbouring state to end pregnancy after US abortion ban
107.article_body: Ohio police have confirmed that a 10-year-old rape victim crossed state lines to terminate her pregnancy after the US Supreme Court overturned a federal right to abortion care. A 27-year-old man from Columbus, Ohio was arrested on July 12 and charged with raping the girl. The girl received an abortion in Indianapolis, Indiana on June 30.

108.title: Rohit, Dhawan made it look so easy on a difficult pitch: Darren Gough
108.article_body: Former England cricketer Darren Gough has said Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan made batting look easy on a "difficult pitch" in the first England ODI. Gough added, "I am a massive fan of Shikhar Dhawan. He's got a lot of style. He plays some unbelievable shots through the off side." Dhawan scored 31*(54) while Rohit slammed 76*(58) in the game.

109.title: We should be ranked no. 1: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Abdul Razzaq
109.article_body: Talking about Pakistan who're currently ranked sixth in Tests, fourth in ODIs and third in T20Is, ex-Pakistan all-rounder Abdul Razzaq said Pakistan should be ranked number one. "The way we are performing in all...three departments: batting, bowling and fielding, we can see a unity in this side," added Razzaq. "I don't think India can compete with Pakistan," he'd stated.

110.title: Masaba Gupta responds to Instagram user who said 'it's an irony you are in fashion'
110.article_body: An Instagram user commented that Masaba Gupta looked bad and it's an irony she's in fashion. She replied, being in any industry involves talent, hard work and discipline, adding, "As for my face, that's just a pretty bonus (as is my mind that is as sharp as a knife and your bulls**t wouldn't get past it even if you tried)."

111.title: Don't wait for any alliance, gear up for BMC polls: Pawar tells party cadre
111.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday asked his party cadre to gear up preparations for elections to the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). "Don't wait for NCP to stitch up...alliance with any party but start work with an eye on BMC elections," Pawar said. He further asked NCP workers to step up outreach with voters to increase the party's presence.

112.title: Fire breaks out at hotel in Delhi's Paharganj; 10 rescued
112.article_body: A fire reportedly broke out in a room on the second floor of Roma Deluxe Hotel in Delhi's Paharganj on early Thursday morning. The fire tenders have rescued 10 people from the second and third floors of the hotel. "Four fire tenders were rushed to the site. No injuries have been reported so far," Delhi Fire Services said.

113.title: Not yet: Manjrekar on whether Bumrah is in same league as Wasim Akram
113.article_body: On being asked whether Jasprit Bumrah is in the same league as Wasim Akram and Malcolm Marshall, Sanjay Manjrekar said, "Not yet." He added, "Akram and Marshall are the guys who've done it over a long period of time and done it in all conditions. These are all-time greats." Manjrekar, however, stated that Bumrah is currently the most feared pacer.

114.title: US carries out two successful hypersonic missile tests
114.article_body: The US has successfully tested two Lockheed Martin Corp hypersonic missiles recently, the Pentagon said on Wednesday. The US Air Force tested its Air-Launched Rapid Response Weapon (ARRW) booster on Tuesday off the California coast. In a separate test, America's Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency successfully performed the first test of its Operational Fires hypersonic weapon in New Mexico.

115.title: Swimming pool, multi-gym inside park against rules: K'taka HC tells BBMP
115.article_body: Karnataka High Court has ordered the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) against constructing a swimming pool or gym inside the Gayathri Devi Park. Such constructions are prohibited in parks, playfields and open spaces in Karnataka, the HC said. Advocate GR Mohan had alleged that BBMP was doing the illegal construction on proposals given by the 'land mafia'.

116.title: Sri Lanka President boards plane that will take him to Singapore and then to Jeddah
116.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has boarded a Saudi Airlines plane from Maldives that will take him to Singapore and then to Jeddah in Saudi Arabia, Associated Press reported citing Maldives government officials. Rajapaksa had agreed to step down on July 13 after fleeing the country. Sri Lanka Parliament Speaker has said he is yet to receive the resignation letter.

117.title: It's simple, Umran Malik needs time, he's not ready for int'l cricket: Aakash
117.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said pacer Umran Malik is not yet ready for international cricket. "Umran has something that others don't have, extreme pace...but he needs time. He hasn't played a lot of cricket and so he is still raw," added Aakash. Umran had conceded 56 runs in his four overs in the third England T20I.

118.title: Bengaluru police bust inter-state drug racket, drugs worth ₹4 cr seized
118.article_body: Bengaluru City Police's Central Crime Branch (CCB) on Wednesday busted an inter-state drug racket and arrested four persons for smuggling hashish oil and ganja. Police also seized drugs worth ₹4 crore from the accused. According to police, the accused had links with the tribals living in the forests of Andhra Pradesh and used to stay with them to grow marijuana.

119.title: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin, who tested positive for COVID-19, hospitalised
119.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has been admitted to a private hospital in Chennai for investigation and observation for COVID-19-related symptoms. This comes after he said on July 12 that he has tested positive for COVID-19 and isolated himself. Stalin had recently attended a wedding and met a group of people, including the Dravidar Kazhagam leader, K Veeramani.

120.title: 32 killed in K'taka so far amid heavy rains; CM disburses ₹500 cr for restoration work
120.article_body: As many as 32 persons have lost their lives so far in Karnataka due to rain-related incidents. CM Basavaraj Bommai said that ₹500 crore will be disbursed immediately for restoration work of basic infrastructure. CM Bommai added that five people are missing, 34 are injured, more than 300 persons have been evacuated and 14 relief camps have been set up.

121.title: It took me time to get over the Sanjay Dutt hangover: Ranbir on 'Sanju'
121.article_body: Talking about his film 'Sanju' which is a biopic on Sanjay Dutt, Ranbir Kapoor said it took time to get over the "Dutt" hangover. "My eyes became like him, I started smiling...and...walking like him," added Ranbir. Discussing a scene from 'Sanju' where he attends the premiere of 'Rocky', Ranbir had stated, "I was really born as an actor [in it]."

122.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
122.article_body: The IMD has issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states over the next few days. Very heavy rainfall is very likely over Karnataka today. It is very likely over Madhya Pradesh on July 17 and 18 and over Chhattisgarh from July 16 to 18. Odisha, Goa, Maharashtra and Gujarat could also witness heavy rainfall in the next few days.

123.title: He himself knows it hasn't been good, he has got to find his way: Ganguly on Kohli's form
123.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's form, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said, "He himself knows by his own standards it has not been good." "He has got to find his way and become successful, which he has been for the last 12-13 years," Ganguly added. Ganguly further stated that these things happen in sport and have happened to everybody.

124.title: 550 women sue Uber in US, say they were 'raped, harassed' by drivers; firm responds
124.article_body: Uber has been sued in the US by 550 women who claimed they "were kidnapped, sexually assaulted, sexually battered, raped, stalked, harassed, or otherwise attacked by Uber drivers". "Sexual assault is a horrific crime and we take every single report seriously," an Uber spokesperson said. "There is nothing more important than safety," the spokesperson further said.

125.title: If needed, the lion will bite too: Anupam on National Emblem controversy
125.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher has reacted to the controversy over the representation of the National Emblem above the new Parliament building. "If the lion has teeth, it will...show them. This is...the lion of independent India. If needed, the lion will bite too," Anupam tweeted. Several opposition leaders have claimed that the lions were made to look "angry" in the new sculpture.

126.title: Indian Railways books cab for student after train gets cancelled; he shares video message
126.article_body: The Indian Railways booked a cab for an Aerospace engineering student from IIT Madras after his train from Ekta Nagar railway station to Vadodara station was cancelled. Satyam Gadhvi said that due to heavy rains, some portions of the railway tracks connecting Ekta Nagar and Vadodara were washed out. The student shared a video message thanking Indian Railways' staff.

127.title: 11 rescued after wall of abandoned building falls on nearby houses in Pune
127.article_body: As many as 11 persons were rescued after a wall of an abandoned building fell on nearby houses in Pune's Kondhwa Budruk. No casualties or injuries were reported in the incident. "The building is very dilapidated...all the residents have moved out owing to its condition. A side wall of this building fell down on three small houses," an official said.

128.title: Rishi ji was upset after Deepika, Sonam's comments on Ranbir at 'Koffee...': Karan
128.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar revealed Rishi Kapoor was upset after actresses Deepika Padukone and Sonam Kapoor's comments on his son Ranbir Kapoor during their appearance on 'Koffee with Karan' in 2010. "I had to step in to make things alright," he added. "Many times, it has happened...I had to step in to douse the fire after rapid-fire," he stated.

129.title: Anything can be said against ex-VP, nothing against Prez candidate: Cong
129.article_body: Congress leader Pawan Khera said that the situation of the country is such that anything can be said against a Former Vice President but nothing can be said against the political ideologies of a person who is a Presidential candidate. His statement comes a day after BJP accused Hamid Ansari of inviting a Pakistani journalist having links with ISI.

130.title: If Virat Kohli plays in 2nd England ODI, he should replace Shreyas: Jaffer
130.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said if Virat Kohli plays in the second ODI against England, then he should replace Shreyas Iyer in the playing XI. "Suryakumar Yadav batted well in the T20Is. He's in good form, you can't take him out...It's a little unfortunate for Shreyas," added Jaffer. Kohli missed the first ODI due to a groin injury.

131.title: Gupkar alliance, NC greatest hurdle in fight against terrorism: BJP
131.article_body: J&K BJP unit’s spokesperson Girdhari Lal Raina said that the National Conference and Gupkar alliance are the greatest hurdles in the fight against terrorism. "Instead of educating youngsters about the futility of violence and terrorism, these self-centred, power-hungry and pursuers of dynastic politics are instigating people by their inciting statements," Raina added.

132.title: Novak is welcome to Australia: Aus Open director post his deportation
132.article_body: Following Novak Djokovic's deportation from Australia due to being unvaccinated against COVID-19, having arrived for featuring in the Australian Open 2022, the tournament's director Craig Tiley said Djokovic is "always welcome" to Australia. "Djokovic is practically invincible at...Central Stadium," added Tiley. "I was disappointed, I was sad about the way it...played out," Djokovic had said.

133.title: Congress to hold nationwide protest against ED summons to Sonia Gandhi
133.article_body: Congress has announced that it will hold nationwide protest on July 21 when Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi is scheduled to appear before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case. "[Sonia Gandhi] isn't afraid...she will go to...ED office and face this government," said Mallikarjun Kharge. Notably, former Congress President Rahul Gandhi was questioned by ED last month.

134.title: UP woman pours hot oil on 6-yr-old adopted daughter's private parts
134.article_body: A 35-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow was arrested for allegedly causing burn injuries to her six-year-old adopted daughter by pouring hot oil on her private parts. The woman's husband had adopted the girl six months ago as the couple didn't have any children. The woman was, however, unhappy with it and would often misbehave with her, police said.

135.title: Bolein toh bolein kya?: Opposition on list of words banned in Parliament
135.article_body: Reacting to a list of words that are banned in the Parliament, Shiv Sena's Priyanka Chaturvedi tweeted, "Reminded of this meme. Agar karein toh karein kya, bolein toh bolein kya?" TMC's Mahua Moitra tweeted, "Is 'Truth' unparliamentary?" Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said, "All words used by the Opposition to describe the reality of Modi Sarkar now to be considered 'unparliamentary'."

136.title: Ronaldo incredibly frustrated with Man Utd, will leave: Piers Morgan
136.article_body: British broadcaster Piers Morgan said Cristiano Ronaldo is incredibly frustrated by the lack of dedication, desire to win, hunger of the players at Manchester United. "Ronaldo will leave...He is tired," added Morgan. "United are in a pretty bad place...You can't blame Ronaldo for wanting to leave, why would he want to stay?...His frustration has been boiling...throughout the year," he'd stated.

137.title: HC allows impleadment of politicians for Delhi 2020 riots hate speech cases
137.article_body: Delhi High Court allowed the applications impleading several political leaders in connection with alleged hate speeches made during the 2020 Delhi riots. An impleadment plea sought the prosecution of BJP leaders Kapil Mishra, Anurag Thakur, Parvesh Verma and Abhay Verma. Another plea sought for impleadment of leaders including Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, Manish Sisodia and others.

138.title: India's sugar, onion exports affected due to Sri Lankan crisis: Report
138.article_body: The ongoing economic crisis in Sri Lanka has affected the Indian exports of sugar and onion, said a report. Of the 40,000-50,000 tonnes of sugar which Sri Lanka consumes every month, 90% is sourced from India, the report stated. The Indian exporters have stopped sending onions there and the exporters who had traded are yet to receive payments, it said.

139.title: List of words banned in Parliament released
139.article_body: Lok Sabha Secretariat has released a list of words that will be considered unparliamentary, which included 'corrupt', 'lie', 'jumlajeevi', 'nikamma', 'hypocrisy' and 'incompetent'. Words like 'anarchist' and 'dictatorial' will also be expunged if used during debates. The list, however, said that some of the words may not appear unparliamentary unless read in conjunction with other expressions.

140.title: Tourist falls into volcano crater while trying to recover his fallen cellphone in Italy
140.article_body: An American tourist was rescued on Mount Vesuvius near Naples after he slipped into the Italian volcano's crater while trying to recover his fallen cellphone. Reports said that the tourist went off the authorised path to get closer to the crater. The tourist suffered abrasions on his legs, arm and back.

141.title: Ram should be the lead in international films: 'The Witcher...' writer
141.article_body: Screenwriter Aaron Stewart-Ahn, known for writing 'The Witcher: Blood Origin', tweeted that Ram Charan who starred in 'RRR' should be the lead in international films if he features in them. "Hollywood usually doesn't get that...Would love to write a movie for a...star like Ram...just to work with such a great actor and cinematic presence," he added in his tweet.

142.title: What BJP did to tribal rights activist Father Stan Swamy isn’t secret: Ajoy Kumar
142.article_body: Congress’ Ajoy Kumar said BJP is now thinking about Adivasis but what it did to tribal rights activist Father Stan Swamy is not a secret. "The whole country knows BJP's Dalit and anti-tribal policies," he tweeted. Earlier, Kumar said NDA’s Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu represents a "very evil philosophy of India" and should not be made a "symbol of Adivasi".

143.title: Sri Lankan Army refuses to follow instructions of acting President Wickremesinghe
143.article_body: The Sri Lankan Army has refused to follow instructions of acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe to use force against the protestors. Wickremesinghe was appointed as acting President after Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled to the Maldives with his wife. Rajapaksa is heading to Singapore from Maldives, according to reports.

144.title: Actresses are replaced easily, makers wait for yrs for male actors: Taapsee
144.article_body: Taapsee Pannu, speaking about battling sexism in the film industry, has said that the root cause of all the problems that a female actor faces is because they are "easily replaceable". "The ease with which a female actor is replaced is...different from how directors and producers wait for years for a male actor, or write scripts for them," she added.

145.title: I'm confident that Asia Cup will take place in Sri Lanka: Jayasuriya
145.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Sanath Jayasuriya said he's confident that Asia Cup, scheduled to be held in Sri Lanka next month, will take place despite the country's ongoing political and financial crisis. "There's no threat to the tournament. In Sri Lanka, everyone loves cricket," he stated. Meanwhile, the Asian Cricket Council has reportedly kept Bangladesh on standby to host the tournament.

146.title: Will use force as last resort to keep Iran from nuclear weapons: Biden
146.article_body: The US would use force as a last resort to prevent Iran from getting a nuclear weapon, President Joe Biden said. He added that it was a "giant mistake" for the US to quit the 2015 Iran nuclear deal because Iran is "closer to a nuclear weapon now than they were before". The US quit the nuclear deal in 2018.

147.title: 5 abduct waiter for asking them to pay for their meal in Pune; arrested
147.article_body: Five people were arrested for allegedly abducting a waiter who asked them to pay for their meal at a hotel in Pune. According to police, the accused went to a hotel near the New Katraj Tunnel for dinner on Monday. When the waiter asked them to pay for the dinner, they allegedly thrashed him and abducted him on a four-wheeler.

148.title: 92% of eligible Indians late for booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine: Report
148.article_body: According to a Hindustan Times report, 92% of Indians who are eligible for the booster dose of the COVID-19 vaccine have not yet taken these shots. Nearly 594 million adults in India are now "late" for their precaution shots as per data furnished by the Union Health Ministry, the report claimed.

149.title: For everyone, it has become an event film: Kartik on 'Bhool...' success
149.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan was asked the reason why people are still going to theatres to watch his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' despite also being released on an OTT platform. To this, he replied, "It's a community viewing film...For everyone, it has become an event film, that, 'let's go to watch 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', it'll be fun to watch together'."

150.title: Man beats 50-yr-old father to death after fight over loud music in Punjab
150.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested in Punjab's Ludhiana for allegedly beating his 50-year-old father to death. According to the victim's other son, a quarrel broke out between Jagroop Singh and Karam Singh after the latter started playing loud music at night. Jagroop then asked him to stop, following which Karam attacked him with a wooden log.

151.title: Cabinet approves rail link to 3 religious places in Gujarat, Rajasthan
151.article_body: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs has approved construction of 116.65-km Taranga Hill-Ambaji-Abu Road rail line, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said. The estimated cost of the project is ₹2,798.16 crore and it will be completed by 2026-27, the minister said. The railway line will connect two states (Gujarat and Rajasthan), and three religious places (Ambaji, Ajitnath Jain and Mount Abu).

152.title: Ukraine cuts ties with N Korea after it recognises separatist regions
152.article_body: Ukraine has said that it's breaking off diplomatic ties with North Korea after it recognised two separatist Ukrainian regions, Donetsk and Luhansk, as independent states. The move "speaks more about Moscow's toxicity than Pyongyang's", Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said, adding, "Russia has no more allies in the world, except for countries that depend on it financially and politically."

153.title: Shaheen is no less than Bumrah, in fact he has more pace: Salman Butt
153.article_body: With Jasprit Bumrah being hailed as one of the best bowlers across formats after his performance against England, ex-Pakistan captain Salman Butt said Shaheen Afridi is no less than the India pacer. "In fact, Shaheen with experience will only get better [as] he has more pace," added Butt. Bumrah registered figures of 6/19 in the first ODI against England.

154.title: Which are the world's most gender-equal countries as India ranks below Nepal, B'desh?
154.article_body: Iceland is the world's most gender-equal country, followed by Finland, Norway, New Zealand, Sweden, Rwanda, Nicaragua, Namibia, Ireland and Germany, according to World Economic Forum. India has been ranked 135, behind Bangladesh (71), Nepal (96), Sri Lanka (110), Maldives (117) and Bhutan (126). In 2021, India ranked 140 out of a total 156 countries on the index.

155.title: Monkeypox symptoms reported in traveller from UAE: Kerala Health Minister
155.article_body: In a first in India, a person who reached Kerala three days ago from the United Arab Emirates (UAE) has developed symptoms of monkeypox, state Health Minister Veena George said on Thursday. "After he developed symptoms of the disease, his samples were sent to the Virology Institute in Pune. The final results are expected by Thursday evening," the minister said.

156.title: I'll eventually be out of the list of world's richest people: Gates on donation plans
156.article_body: Bill Gates has said, "As I look to the future, my plan is to give all my wealth to the Gates Foundation other than what I spend on myself and my family." "I do some...investing in US health care issues...outside the foundation," he added. "I'll move down and eventually off of the list of the world's richest people," he stated.

157.title: Thackeray forced to back NDA's Presidential candidate: Yashwant Sinha
157.article_body: Opposition candidate for Presidential polls Yashwant Sinha said that ex-Maharashtra CM and Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray was "forced" to declare that his party would support the NDA’s candidate, Droupadi Murmu. "I am not only fighting a political party, I am fighting for the government and finally the cat is out of the bag," Sinha added.

158.title: BJP playing dirty politics over upcoming Presidential polls: TMC leader
158.article_body: TMC's Partha Chatterjee said that the BJP is playing "dirty politics" over upcoming Presidential polls. "The NDA nominee was in Kolkata and didn’t ask for votes of Opposition legislators. But BJP leadership has written letters to our MLAs and MPs, seeking their support," Chatterjee added. "When candidate herself hasn't made any appeal, who are they to write letters?" he asked.

159.title: Police attach properties worth ₹100 cr of ex-UP minister in illegal meat factory case
159.article_body: Police on Wednesday attached properties worth over ₹100 crore of BSP leader and former Uttar Pradesh minister Haji Yaqoob Qureshi in connection with a case registered against him for allegedly running an illegal meat factory. An FIR was registered against 17 people, including Qureshi, his wife and sons after illegal meat worth over ₹5 crore was recovered from his factory.

160.title: BMC to hire teachers for ₹150 per hour for government schools
160.article_body: Considering the fact that permanent appointments could take time, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to recruit teachers on an hourly basis for over 800 vacant posts. The teachers will be paid ₹150 per hour and the funds for the purpose will be allotted by the BMC. As per new rules, schools can re-hire retired teachers as well.

161.title: India can't progress if it's caught in shackles of casteism: KT Rama Rao
161.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao on Wednesday said India cannot progress if it is caught in the shackles of casteism. "If caste and religion references are used...when progress is being made in all fields, it will cause serious damage to...country," he said during the launch of book "Charitraputtalo Telangana". He further urged the youth to grow with secular sentiments.

162.title: Which states have most active COVID-19 cases as India reports highest cases in 5 months?
162.article_body: India on Thursday saw 20,139 new COVID-19 cases, the highest daily cases reported since February. West Bengal has the most active COVID-19 cases in the country at 27,496, followed by Kerala with 26,451 active cases and Tamil Nadu with 18,282 active cases. Maharashtra has 16,922 active COVID-19 cases while Karnataka has 6,603 active cases.

163.title: Ex-IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt arrested from jail in 2002 Gujarat riots case
163.article_body: Gujarat Police arrested former IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt from jail in connection with a 2002 Gujarat riots case. He has been accused of allegedly abusing the law by conspiring to fabricate evidence to frame innocent people in connection with the riots. Bhatt was the deputy commissioner incharge of Internal Security at the State Intelligence Bureau when the riots broke out.

164.title: Big B has managed to stay relevant, I follow him earnestly: Madhavan
164.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has revealed that veteran actors Amitabh Bachchan and Clint Eastwood are the two people he follows "earnestly". "At [92], Eastwood is still making movies that he wants to, breaking rules, winning Oscars. Amitabh sir too has always managed to stay relevant," he stated. Recently, Madhavan had featured in 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'.

165.title: Virat Kohli doesn't have the same talent as Rohit Sharma: Imam Ul Haq
165.article_body: Pakistan opener Imam Ul Haq said Virat Kohli doesn't have the same "talent" as Rohit Sharma, adding the latter can change the game in seconds. "Kohli has batted in front of me, so has Rohit...but Rohit has been gifted a lot of time by God," he stated. "It feels...[like] Rohit is batting in replay...He can hit at will," said Imam.

166.title: Water supply to be affected in Thane for next 3-4 days
166.article_body: Thane city will face water shortage over the next three to four days as the Bhatsa Dam has overflown due to continuous heavy rains. The overflowing water has led to waterlogging at the Pise filtration plant in Bhiwandi. The strainer at the plant is clogged with silt and garbage impacting the supply of water to the city.

167.title: Shiv Sena's poll symbol 'bow & arrow' should go to Shinde faction: Athawale
167.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale said Shiv Sena’s poll symbol, 'bow and arrow', should go to Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led faction. "As many as 40 out of 55 Shiv Sena MLAs are with Shinde…I am sure he'll lay claim for symbol because he has [over] two-thirds of MLAs with him," he added. The real Shiv Sena belongs to Shinde, Athawale stated.

168.title: To get back at ex-lover, Mumbai woman steals bike he used for food delivery
168.article_body: A 21-year-old woman from Vikhroli was arrested for allegedly stealing her ex-boyfriend's motorcycle he used for food delivery to get back at him. He'd stopped talking to her after he was arrested for rape on her family's complaint three years ago. The accused stole his bike and promised to tell him its location if he started speaking to her again.

169.title: A businessman offered me ₹25 lakh/month 'to become his salaried wife': Neetu Chandra
169.article_body: Actress Neetu Chandra has revealed that a big businessman told her "to become his salaried wife" for which he would give her ₹25 lakh per month. "Having worked with 13 National award winners and in such big films, today I have no work," she said. "I feel unwanted here after doing so much work," she added.

170.title: India sees 20,139 new COVID-19 cases, highest in 5 months; positivity rate jumps to 5.10%
170.article_body: India has reported 20,139 new COVID-19 cases and 38 deaths in the last 24 hours. This is the first time since February that the daily COVID-19 cases in the country crossed the 20,000-mark. The daily positivity rate in India jumped from 3.68% to 5.10%, while the active caseload in the country reached 1,36,076.

171.title: I'd have loved to play under them, I really would: Pietersen on 'Bazball'
171.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen has said he would've loved to play under the management of England Test coach McCullum and captain Ben Stokes. On England's 'Bazball' approach, Pietersen said, "I love the way the team are playing now. It's exciting, it's positive." He added, "I can only imagine how much happier I would've been, how much better I would've been."

172.title: Actors in OTT have become stars without 24 inches waistline: Kajol
172.article_body: Actress Kajol has said that the OTT platforms have brought out "some fabulous actors". "You have people who are...fabulous actors getting a stage...becoming stars in their own right despite the fact that they don't have a 24 inches waistline...or a 46 inches chest," she added. Kajol stated it's a "fabulous time" for actors as they're getting a lot of exposure.

173.title: Section 144 at all tourist spots in Pune till July 17: District Collector
173.article_body: Pune District Collector has imposed Section 144 at all the tourist spots in the city due to heavy rain forecast till July 17. Accordingly, a gathering of five or more persons has been banned within a one-kilometre radius of forts, waterfalls etc. "It is also prohibited to take pictures while swimming in water or near waterfalls," the order stated.

174.title: Hyderabad Police Commissioner orders transfer of 69 inspectors
174.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand on Wednesday ordered the transfer of 69 police inspectors of various wings. A comprehensive enquiry into the personal life, reputation and integrity of all inspectors picked was also conducted before selecting them for the police units, a release said. This comes days after Marredpally SHO K Nageshwar Rao was arrested in an alleged rape case.

175.title: I wouldn't be disappointed to face Trump again in 2024: Biden
