349.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has become the world number one ODI bowler in the latest rankings released by ICC. The 28-year-old, who recorded his best bowling figures in ODIs by taking six wickets for 19 runs against England on Tuesday, jumped five places to reach the top spot. New Zealand fast bowler Trent Boult has dropped to the second position.

350.title: Scindia's new bungalow in Bhopal flooded with drain water amid rain, video surfaces
350.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia's new government bungalow in Bhopal's Shymala Hills getting flooded with drain water amid continuous rain. In the video, a worker can be seen draining out the water using a wiper. Scindia had shifted to the bungalow in May this year after its renovation.

351.title: Owner of car with 'Papa' number plate in Uttarakhand fined; police shares pic
351.article_body: The owner of a car has been fined by the Uttarakhand Police over its number plate that read "Papa". Police shared before and after pictures of the number plate on Twitter and said that it received the complaint through a tweet. Twitter users praised the police for its action against the car owner.

352.title: 20-yr-old Mumbai student on picnic in Lonavala drowns in waterfall
352.article_body: A 20-year-old BCom student from Mumbai reportedly drowned in a waterfall near Bhushi dam on Monday. The deceased, Sahil Saroj, had come for a picnic in Lonavala with a group of 250 students. "Sahil and his friend went to the...waterfall...He waded into the gushing waters...and failed to come out. He fell from the cliff from where waterfall starts," police said.

353.title: Maha CM asks officials to keep emergency services on alert amid rains
353.article_body: Speaking about the monsoon rains situation in Maharashtra, newly appointed Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said that he has directed the district officials to keep emergency services on alert. He also asked the officials to ensure that no untoward incident occurs and assistance reaches the affected people on time. Several districts of Maharashtra are on red and orange alert.

354.title: Bumrah's wife Sanjana trolls England batters by visiting 'Crispy Duck' stall
354.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah's wife Sanjana Ganesan visited a stall called 'Crispy Duck' at The Oval to troll England after four of their batters got out for ducks in the first ODI. She said, "We've come to...stall that not a lot of English batters would like to come to...We want to see how good the duck is off the field."

355.title: I really don't know: Bumrah on status of Kohli's groin strain
355.article_body: Team India pacer Jasprit Bumrah, on being asked about the status of Virat Kohli's injury after the first ODI against England, said he doesn't know the status of the injury. "Because I didn't play the last game (3rd T20I). Hopefully, he recovers, but I really don't know," stated Bumrah. Kohli missed the first ODI due to a "mild groin strain".

356.title: Nobody's done what we're doing with ancient Indian inspiration: Ayan
356.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji, who's directed the upcoming film 'Brahmastra', said, "No one's...done what we are doing with ancient Indian inspiration in the modern world ever." Talking about the character of Ranbir Kapoor, Ayan stated, "He's a miracle because he's an astra himself - Agni astra...He is named after the God who is the...all powerful and my greatest inspiration, Shiva."

357.title: Dengue cases surge in West Bengal, highest in last 4 yrs
357.article_body: Dengue cases are rising in West Bengal as the state recorded a four-year high in first 26 weeks of this year. While the state registered 1,037 dengue cases in first 26 weeks of 2019, that number dropped to 619 and 273 in 2020 and 2021, respectively. However, it has shot up to 1,751 in first 26 weeks of 2022.

358.title: 21-yr-old woman jumps off moving SUV to escape molestation bid in Lucknow
358.article_body: A 21-year-old woman reportedly jumped off a moving SUV to escape a molestation bid in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. She was rushed to a hospital after sustaining injuries in the incident. "The accused had offered a lift to the girl...After driving some distance, he started making advances towards her and...tried to molest her," police said. He was arrested on Tuesday.

359.title: 5 killed in 24 hours in Maharashtra amid heavy rains; death toll rises to 89
359.article_body: At least five persons were killed in 24 hours amid heavy rains and flood-like situations across various districts in Maharashtra. The total death toll has risen to 89. One person died in Raigad due to the collapse of a structure and another died in Palghar in a landslide. Notably, three persons lost their lives in Nagpur due to flash floods.

360.title: Woman's body found near posh residential complex in Greater Noida
360.article_body: The body of an unidentified woman was found near a posh residential apartment complex in Greater Noida on Tuesday, police said. "The woman is around 35 years old and we are trying to identify her," police added. "There is a deep cut on her left wrist due to which she seems to have lost a lot of blood," police stated.

361.title: Raj govt to study recruitment exam models of Tamil Nadu, Kerala: Gehlot
361.article_body: The Rajasthan government will study recruitment examination models of Tamil Nadu and Kerala for the smooth conduct of such exams in the state, CM Ashok Gehlot said on Tuesday. A high-level team will visit both states to get detailed information, he added. Notably, the Rajasthan Police Constable recruitment exam was cancelled in May following a paper leak.

362.title: You get such wickets very rarely: Shami on The Oval ODI vs England
362.article_body: India pacer Mohammad Shami said pacers are always longing to bowl on wickets like the one they got in the first ODI against England at The Oval on Tuesday. "You get such wickets very rarely...it is a different feeling that the ball is going to do something now," he added. Shami picked three wickets, conceding 31 runs in the match.

363.title: Sri Lanka Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe appointed acting President
363.article_body: Sri Lanka Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has been appointed as the acting President of the country. This comes after President Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled Sri Lanka on a military jet amid mass protests over the economic crisis. The country's air force confirmed the 73-year-old flew to the Maldives with his wife and two security officials.

364.title: SC refuses to pass interim order staying demolitions across states
364.article_body: Supreme Court refused to pass an interim order staying demolitions across states. It cannot pass an omnibus order preventing authorities from taking action, the court added. "Rule of law has to be followed...But can we pass an omnibus order?" SC stated. It was hearing pleas over demolitions of properties of alleged accused in cases of violence in various states.

365.title: Congress has to do a lot of introspection: Digambar Kamat
365.article_body: Former Goa CM Digambar Kamat said Congress has to do a lot of introspection as the party is losing so many polls and leaders are leaving. "I worked for the party with sincerity," Kamat added. His statement came after Congress accused Michael Lobo and Kamat of "conspiring and hobnobbing" with BJP to engineer a split in the party’s legislative wing.

366.title: 80% ready to pay premium for environmentally-safe products: Public poll
366.article_body: 83% of the 1.76 lakh people surveyed across India said that they support the ban on single-use plastic, according to a poll conducted on Public, India's largest location-based social network. Although 62.8% believe the ban might cause some inconvenience to their day-to-day lives, about 80% said they are willing to switch to expensive, environmentally safe products to protect the environment.

367.title: Chris didn't eat meat before kiss in 'Thor: Love...' as I'm vegan: Natalie
367.article_body: Talking about her kissing scene with Chris Hemsworth in the film 'Thor: Love and Thunder', actress Natalie Portman said, "The day we had a kiss scene he didn't eat meat that morning because I'm vegan." "He eats meat like every half [an] hour," added Natalie. "I didn't even know Chris could go without eating meat," stated their co-star Tessa Thompson.

368.title: Bengaluru's St Joseph's College upgraded to a university
368.article_body: St Joseph's College (Autonomous) in Karnataka's Bengaluru has been upgraded to St Joseph's University, the university's management announced on Tuesday. The university is expected to be fully operational for academic year 2022-23. Notably, the process to confer the university status began in 2013 when the Ministry of Education launched the Rashtriya Uchchatar Shiksha Abhiyan (RUSA) scheme.

369.title: Rupee hits new lifetime low of 79.67 per US dollar
369.article_body: The Indian rupee hit a new record low of 79.67 for a third straight session on Wednesday. In the previous session, the rupee had collapsed to close at 79.60 against the dollar. "There is a general risk-off sentiment. Until flows come back, we will see the dollar being bid against currencies like ours," a senior trader told Reuters.

370.title: We recreated Partition so beautifully, it really moves: 'Ms...' actor
370.article_body: Discussing the Partition in 1947 being recreated in 'Ms Marvel', the show's actor Mohan Kapur said, "The scenes are shot so beautifully and it really moves. Wow!" "I don’t know how many people...know about (the Partition)...That was our genocide," added Mohan. 'Ms Marvel' director Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy had earlier said there were close to 1,000 extras on set in the scene.

371.title: DRI detects customs duty evasion of ₹4,389 crore by Oppo India
371.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has detected customs duty evasion of nearly ₹4,389 crore by Oppo India. Searches were conducted by DRI at office of Oppo India and residences of its key management employees. This led to the recovery of incriminating evidence indicating wilful mis-declaration in the description of certain items imported by Oppo India.

372.title: I know what it feels like, it's not nice: Morgan on England's 10-wicket loss
372.article_body: Reacting to England's 10-wicket defeat in the first ODI against India, ex-England captain Eoin Morgan said Jos Buttler, the current English skipper, will have to take this as an opportunity to "reiterate a strong message about where they are going and what they're doing". Morgan added, "I know what this feels like. It's not nice...but [this] is time to lead."

373.title: Delhi HC allows Vivo to operate bank accounts if it furnishes bank guarantee of ₹950 cr
373.article_body: The Delhi High Court has allowed Chinese smartphone manufacturer Vivo to operate its bank accounts if it furnishes a bank guarantee of ₹950 crore. The court has also directed Vivo to maintain ₹250 crore in its accounts. Vivo India on Friday approached the court challenging the freezing of its bank accounts by ED in connection with a money laundering case.

374.title: Man attacks policemen with shaving blade in Delhi's Dwarka; arrested
374.article_body: A 39-year-old man was arrested for attacking two policemen with a shaving blade in Delhi's Dwarka area on Tuesday. The accused was chasing another person with the blade to allegedly attack him. When the policemen caught him, the accused reportedly assaulted them. One of them suffered injuries on his head while the other suffered injuries on his hand, police said.

375.title: Droupadi Murmu represents very evil philosophy of India: Congress leader
375.article_body: Congress leader Ajoy Kumar said NDA’s Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu represents a "very evil philosophy of India" and should not be made a "symbol of Adivasi". Following Kumar’s statement, BJP’s spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said that Congress has insulted Murmu. "Yashwant Sinha is also a good candidate," Kumar added. "[PM] Modi-led government is fooling people," he stated.

376.title: Muslims using most contraceptives: Owaisi on UP CM’s 'population imbalance' remark
376.article_body: Following UP CM Yogi Adityanath’s "population imbalance" remark, AIMIM’s Asaduddin Owaisi said that Muslims are the ones using most contraceptives. "The total fertility rate which was 2.6 in 2016 is now 2.3. The country’s demographic dividend is the best among all countries," Owaisi added. "Their own Health Minister said no law is needed in country for population control," Owaisi stated.

377.title: Water level of Navi Mumbai's Ransai Dam reaches 112 ft, to overflow anytime
377.article_body: The water level of Ransai Dam located in Navi Mumbai's Uran area has reached 112.5 feet after continuous heavy rainfall in Maharashtra. As per report, the water level in the dam can anytime cross its maximum level of 116.5 feet and it will start overflowing. The Ransai Dam supplies water to more than one lakh people in 37 gram panchayats.

378.title: Central schemes have become scams in West Bengal: Smriti Irani
378.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday said that the central schemes have become "scams" in West Bengal. "People have asked me to inform the administration to get them the central schemes as they are deprived of it," Irani added. She further said that she has spoken with the district administration and informed them about the "distress" of the people.

379.title: BMC staffer arrested in Mumbai for unnatural sex with man, causing him burns
379.article_body: A BMC employee was arrested for reportedly having unnatural sex with a 33-year-old man in Mumbai. The complainant said the accused was upset as he had demanded ₹6,000 from him. On July 6, after paying the money, the accused allegedly beat up the complainant and had unnatural sex with him, causing burn injuries to his private parts.

380.title: Which Indian places have been featured in TIME's 'The World's Greatest Places of 2022'?
380.article_body: TIME magazine has published a list of 'The World's Greatest Places of 2022' featuring "50 extraordinary destinations to explore" which includes India's Kerala and Ahmedabad. Calling Kerala the ecotourism hot spot, TIME said it is one of India's most beautiful states. The magazine said India's first UNESCO World Heritage City Ahmedabad is a mecca for cultural tourism and higher learning.

381.title: Pic of Elon Musk's business card from 1995 goes viral
381.article_body: A picture of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's business card from 1995 has gone viral on social media. The picture was shared by a Twitter handle named DogeDesigner. Responding to the picture of the card, which described Musk as Chairman of the Board, Chief Technology Officer and Co-founder of Zip2, Musk tweeted, "Ancient times."

382.title: COVID cases may increase five-fold: S Korea as cases hit 2-month high
382.article_body: Daily COVID-19 infections in South Korea on Wednesday jumped above 40,000 for the first time in two months, with the government warning of a potential five-fold surge in infections. Wednesday's figure of 40,266 represents an 8% jump over the previous day. "Daily infections could soar to...2,00,000 between mid-August and late September," PM Han Duck-soo told a government COVID-19 response meeting.

383.title: Wish to buy my films, watch myself as I'm very scared of judgement: Ranbir
383.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor said he wishes to buy all his films and watch them himself as he is "very scared" of judgement. "My last film 'Sanju', which came out four years ago, was a big hit. But still, people are saying that 'Shamshera' is my comeback film," added Ranbir. "So I do not understand what is this comeback film," he stated.

384.title: South films are remade in Hindi with cynical attitude: Producer Siddharth
384.article_body: Producer Siddharth Roy Kapur, who produced Aamir Khan-starrer 'Dangal', said, "South films are often remade in Hindi with a 'cynical attitude' because they worked in the past." "Unless the filmmakers...share the conviction of their South counterparts, they will not work," added Siddharth. "There has been no concentrated and strategic effort [by Bollywood] to cross state boundaries," he stated.

385.title: CNG, PNG prices hiked by ₹4 and ₹3 in Mumbai; 4th hike in 2022
385.article_body: Mahanagar Gas Limited has increased the prices of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) and Piped Natural Gas (PNG) prices in and around Mumbai by ₹4 and ₹3 respectively. CNG will now cost ₹80 per kilogram whereas PNG will cost ₹48.50 per Standard Cubic Metre (SCM). Notably, this is the fourth hike in the prices of natural gas in 2022.

386.title: Safari Park at Hyderabad's Nehru Zoo flooded amid heavy rainfall
386.article_body: The Safari Park at Hyderabad's Nehru Zoological Park was flooded after heavy rainfall caused water in the Mir Alam Tank to overflow and enter the premises, Zoo officials said on Tuesday. Following the inundation, authorities declared the Safari Park closed to the public. However, the remainder of the Zoo will remain available to visitors from 8.30 am to 4.30 pm.

387.title: Sri Lanka declares state of emergency after President escapes to Maldives
387.article_body: Sri Lanka has declared a state of emergency after President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's escape to Maldives, the Prime Minister's office said. Thousands of protesters took to the streets of Sri Lanka's capital Colombo, demanding Rajapaksa's immediate resignation. Police fired tear gas to scatter protesters near Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe's office.

388.title: 4 killed as under-construction railway underpass collapses in J'khand
388.article_body: Four workers died after an under-construction railway underpass collapsed in Jharkhand's Dhanbad district on Tuesday night. According to officials, the labourers were working at the underpass between Pradhankanta and Sindri rail section. The portion caved in after a goods train crossed from a nearby track following which Railway and administrative officials rushed to the spot, officials added.

389.title: Dozens dead, thousands trapped without food as gangs battle in Haiti
389.article_body: Gun battles between rival gangs in the Haitian town of Cite Soleil have left thousands trapped without access to water, food or medical care, international aid group Doctors Without Borders said. Dozens of people have reportedly died in four days of gang battles. Cite Soleil, which lies on the outskirts of Haiti's capital Port-au-Prince, has a population of around 2,50,000.

390.title: Rhea, Sushant's flatmate Siddharth abetted the actor's extreme drug addiction: NCB
390.article_body: The NCB in its draft charge against 35 accused booked in the alleged drugs case filed after Sushant Singh Rajput's death said they entered a criminal conspiracy for distribution of drugs in Bollywood. Drugs were procured for Sushant by his flatmate Siddharth Pithani, Rhea Chakraborty and others who "aided and abetted" the actor to "extreme drug addiction", it added.

391.title: Genetically engineered pig hearts successfully transplanted into 2 dead people in US
391.article_body: A team at NYU Langone Health successfully transplanted two genetically engineered pig hearts into recently deceased humans with an aim to provide an alternative supply of organs for people with life-threatening heart disease amid shortages. The surgeries were performed over several hours and heart function was monitored for three days. No signs of early rejection were observed in either organ.

392.title: India is mother of all democracies: PM Modi in Bihar
392.article_body: Addressing an event in Bihar, PM Narendra Modi said that India is not just the largest democracy but it is also the "mother of all democracies". The PM also stated that the nation was "on its way to becoming a mature democracy" which was evident from "better attendance of lawmakers inside Parliament and state assemblies" and "discarding of obsolete laws".

393.title: 1 dead, 2 seriously injured in landslide in Vasai in Maharashtra's Palghar
393.article_body: At least one person died and two others were seriously injured in a landslide incident in the Vasai area of Maharashtra's Palghar district amid heavy rains, the District Collector said. At least two persons have been rescued so far and three are still feared trapped. Local firemen rescued a woman and her daughter from their house, officials said.

394.title: If Kohli doesn't play the next game, then it would be more than a niggle: Ojha
394.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha has said if Virat Kohli doesn't play in the second ODI against England, then his injury could be more than a "mild groin strain". He stated that Kohli should be fit if he's suffering from a niggle. However, according to a report, Kohli is yet to recover and is unlikely to play in the second ODI.

395.title: We support tribals: Aaditya Thackeray on Shiv Sena supporting Murmu
395.article_body: Soon after ex-Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray announced that Shiv Sena will support Droupadi Murmu for Presidential polls, Aaditya Thackeray said his party has decided to do so as Murmu is a tribal woman. "Today we've different political views but Droupadi Murmu is a tribal woman and we support tribals. That's why we will vote in favour of Murmu," he added.

396.title: LGBTQ members allege harassment by police at Pune event
396.article_body: The organisers of a private LGBTQ event held in Pune on July 9 have complained of harassment by the police. Writing to the Police Commissioner, they alleged that police locked around 150 members of their community inside the event venue without a warrant. "They...proceeded to use homophobic and derogatory statements," the founder of Mist LGBTQ Foundation told The Indian Express.

397.title: Rishi Kapoor & I argued, fought with each other: Karan on Agneepath
397.article_body: Karan Malhotra, the director of Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Agneepath' which also featured late actor Rishi Kapoor, said, "[Rishi and I] would argue [and] fight...[over] the character arc." Karan added that they threw challenges at each other. "[Rishi] was...very flamboyant, loud...and...confrontational," he had earlier stated. Karan has directed Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Shamshera'.

398.title: 5 held in UP's Prayagraj for anti-Modi poster, T'gana man likely involved
398.article_body: The Prayagraj Police arrested five people in connection with an anti-Modi poster that was put up in the city. The police named a man hailing from Telangana as the prime accused in the matter. The accused have been booked under IPC Section 153B (hurting religious sentiments) and Section 505 (2) (statements creating and promoting enmity, hatred, or ill-will between classes).

399.title: 9 years on, the bond is still strong with Rohit Sharma: Shikhar Dhawan
399.article_body: After India openers Shikhar Dhawan and Rohit Sharma remained unbeaten to chase down England's 111-run target in their first ODI on Tuesday, Dhawan tweeted a picture of him and Rohit and wrote, "Nine years on, the bond is still strong Rohit." In the match, the duo became the fourth opening pair in ODI cricket to complete 5,000 runs in partnership.

400.title: Bradley Cooper is dating Hillary Clinton's former top aide Huma Abedin: Report
400.article_body: Bradley Cooper is dating Huma Abedin, the former top aide to Hillary Clinton and former wife of politician Anthony Weiner, according to Page Six. They were reportedly introduced by Vogue editor Anna Wintour, who is close to both Cooper and Abedin. The couple arrived together at the Met Gala event, however, they parted ways for the red carpet, reports claimed.

401.title: US First Lady apologises after saying Latinos unique as 'breakfast tacos'
401.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden has apologised for saying Latinos are as unique as "breakfast tacos". "The First Lady apologises that her words conveyed anything but pure admiration and love for...Latino community," her spokesperson said. Condemning Biden's comments, National Association of Hispanic Journalists had said, "We're not tacos. Our heritage as Latinos...shouldn't be reduced to a stereotype."

402.title: Anand Mahindra shares edited pic showing 'future of UK PM's residence'; it goes viral
402.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share an edited picture showing the "future of UK PM's residence". "The future of 10 Downing Street? The famed British humour is now laced with Desi humour," Mahindra wrote. Mahindra shared the picture as Rishi Sunak, who has Indian roots, is one of the contenders for UK Prime Minister's post.

403.title: 47-yr-old woman found dead in lodge in Mumbai, boyfriend absconding
403.article_body: A 47-year-old woman was found dead in a lodge near Aksa Beach in Mumbai's Malad on Tuesday evening, an official said. The man, reportedly her boyfriend, is absconding, he added. The two had checked into the lodge on Monday night and began fighting soon after, he further said. "On Tuesday morning, the man left the place," the official stated.
